policies.involuntary_reissue:
Voluntary reissues must comply with applicable fare rules, including fare difference and change fees.
• Involuntary reissues (e.g. due to schedule change) may be eligible; coordinate with Air Vanuatu Sales Support.
• Reissue requests for changes to routing, class, or date must be validated in advance.
• Do not assume automatic eligibility without written approval.
• Unused coupon sequences must be preserved; reissued tickets must follow original fare construction rules.
policies.voluntary_refund:
Refunds for voluntary cancellations are subject to applicable fare rules.
• If no portion of the ticket has been used: passenger is entitled to a refund equal to the fare paid (including applicable taxes, government charges, and airport costs), less any service charges or cancellation fees.
• If a portion of the ticket has been used: refund equals the difference between the fare paid and the applicable fare for the used portion of travel (including applicable taxes and charges), less any service charges or cancellation fees.
• All voluntary refunds must be processed to the original form of payment and are issued only to the original purchaser.
• Refund eligibility may vary depending on fare type (e.g., promotional or restricted fares may be non-refundable).
policies.medical_refund:
Waiver requests—whether voluntary or involuntary—must be directed to internal support or ARC.
• No overrides to fare rules are allowed without written permission.
• All authorization codes and approval documentation must be retained.
• For restructuring-related exceptions, coordinate via: Creditors.AirVanuatu@au.ey.com.
policies.name_change:
Name changes are allowed for a fee per passenger.
• Changes must be processed via Air Vanuatu website, call center, or authorized agents only.
• Bookings made via agents must be modified by that same agent.
• Tickets are non-transferable and cannot be used by another person even if the name is changed informally.
policies.group_booking:
Group booking policies are not explicitly detailed.
• For unaccompanied minors or children traveling with different surnames, additional documentation (e.g., signed consent and birth certificate) may be required.
• Contact Sales Support for structured group terms and conditions.
policies.infant_policy:
Infants (under 2 years old) must travel on the adult’s lap and pay 10% of the adult fare.
• No bassinets are available on international flights.
• Each infant must be accompanied by an adult.
• Infants are not eligible for a seat unless one is purchased separately.
• Baggage allowance: 10kg + 1 collapsible stroller or car seat at no charge.
policies.baggage_policy:
• Adult/Child Domestic: 10kg checked baggage, 5kg carry-on.
• Infant: 10kg checked (international); 0kg on domestic routes.
• Children receive the same allowance as adults.
• 1 stroller or car seat per infant/child carried at no cost.
• Dangerous goods and valuable items (e.g. laptops, jewelry, passports) must not be checked.
• Oversized or excess baggage may be refused or carried separately at passenger expense.
policies.seat_request_policy:
Seat selection is not guaranteed and subject to change due to operational needs.
• Emergency exit row seats are only available to passengers over age 15 who are able-bodied and understand English.
• Cabin crew and operations may reassign seats for safety.
• Infants do not receive individual seats and must travel on adult laps unless a seat is purchased.
policies.short_term_cancellation_policy:
Air Vanuatu does not explicitly define a same-day void window in public materials.
• Refund requests must be formally submitted and processed through applicable fare rules.
• No refund or credit is issued for failure to show up unless eligible under the ticket's fare rules or schedule disruption policies.
